alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Warning issued December 22 at 8:18AM EST until December 22 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...One to two feet of inundation above ground level along shorelines and tidal waterways (8.1 to 8.3 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...Until 9 AM EST this morning. * IMPACTS...This will result in some roads becoming impassable and minor flooding of properties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide occurred around 6:37 AM this morning at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will remain possible around 2 hours after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 22/07 AM 8.2 2.4 1.7 N/A Major 22/07 PM 5.6 -0.2 0.4 N/A None 23/07 AM 5.5 -0.3 -1.1 N/A None 23/08 PM 4.0 -1.8 -1.3 N/A None 24/09 AM 6.1 0.3 -0.5 N/A None 24/09 PM 5.0 -0.8 -0.3 N/A None &&
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. If travel is required, do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
